Package com.pb.sawdust.util.collections.cache

Provides classes relating to caches.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Cache<K,V>
    A Cache is a Map with a defined strategy for removing key-value pairs.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractRefCache<K,V>
    The AbstractRefCache class provides a basic Cache implementation which orders its keys based on when they are referenced.
    BoundedCache<K,V>
    The BoundedCache is a cache which is limited by the sum of its values's sizes.
    BoundedCountCache<K,V>
    The BoundedCountCache is a cache whose key-value pair count is limited.
    DefinedCache<K,V>
    The DefinedCache provides a cache which is explicitly cleaned via method calls.
    ReferenceCache<K,V,RK extends java.lang.ref.Reference<K>,RV extends java.lang.ref.Reference<V>>
    The ReferenceCache class defines a cache which holds references (in the java.lang.ref.Reference sense) to its keys and values.
    SoftCache<K,V>
    The SoftCache class defines a cache which holds soft references to its keys.
    WeakCache<K,V>
    The WeakCache class defines a cache which holds weak references to its keys.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AbstractRefCache.CacheCleaningPriority
    The CacheCleaningPriority enum is used to define the frequency with which an AbstractRefCache is cleaned.

Package com.pb.sawdust.util.collections.cache Description

Provides classes relating to caches. Caches are Maps with defined strategies for removing key-value pairs.
